dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Housing costs in Astana have just gone through the roof, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Housing costs in Astana have just gone through the roof, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I was just looking at the latest from Kazakhstan's Bureau of National Statistics—Astana's annual inflation hit 13.8 percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I was just looking at the latest from Kazakhstan's Bureau of National Statistics-Astana's annual inflation hit thirteen point eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The highest annual inflation rates were recorded in Astana (13.8 percent), the Karaganda region (12.8 percent), and the Akmola region (11.8 percent).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That is… a lot. And it's not just the capital, right? The Karaganda region was up there too at 12.8 percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is... a lot. And it's not just the capital, right? The Karaganda region was up there too at twelve point eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The highest annual inflation rates were recorded in Astana (13.8 percent), the Karaganda region (12.8 percent), and the Akmola region (11.8 percent).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But then you've got Pavlodar with the lowest rate at 7.6 percent, which is still pretty high by most standards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But then you've got Pavlodar with the lowest rate at seven point six percent, which is still pretty high by most standards.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pavlodar region saw the lowest rate at 7.6 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And month-to-month, they saw a slight dip, right? April was 1.2 percent after 1.3 in March.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And month-to-month, they saw a slight dip, right? April was one point two percent after one point three in March.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the bureau, the monthly consumer price index in April reached 1.2 percent, slightly down from 1.3 percent in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but year-on-year it actually accelerated to 10.7 percent. Paid services were the real standout though—up 15.7 percent annually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but year-on-year it actually accelerated to ten point seven percent. Paid services were the real standout though-up fifteen point seven percent annually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Year-on-year, inflation accelerated to 10.7 percent in April, up from 10 percent in March. Paid services rose the most, increasing by 15.7 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oof, that hurts. And food and non-food goods both went up around 8 to 9 percent too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof, that hurts. And food and non-food goods both went up around eight to nine percent too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prices for non-food goods grew by 8.9 percent, while food products climbed by 8.5 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It makes you wonder how people are coping, especially with utility tariffs seeing some of the steepest hikes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes you wonder how people are coping, especially with utility tariffs seeing some of the steepest hikes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Utility tariffs saw some of the steepest increases over the year: Service sectors also experienced notable hikes: Transportation costs rose significantly: Prices of various goods also climbed: Among food items, the biggest price hikes were recorded for: Some products, however, saw price drops: The National Bank of Kazakhstan recently revised its inflation outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the National Bank isn't exactly optimistic—they revised their inflation outlook upward for the next few years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the National Bank isn't exactly optimistic-they revised their inflation outlook upward for the next few years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Bank of Kazakhstan recently revised its inflation outlook. Experts now expect inflation to reach 10.6 percent in 2025 (up from 8.7 percent), 9 percent in 2026 (up from 7 percent), and 6.1 percent in 2027 (up from 5.8 percent).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like expecting 10.6 percent in 2025 instead of 8.7. That's a pretty significant adjustment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like expecting ten point six percent in twenty twenty five instead of eight point seven. That's a pretty significant adjustment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Experts now expect inflation to reach 10.6 percent in 2025 (up from 8.7 percent), 9 percent in 2026 (up from 7 percent), and 6.1 percent in 2027 (up from 5.8 percent).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. Makes you think this isn't just a short-term spike.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. Makes you think this isn't just a short-term spike.
